references.paper_title: Database-friendly random projections: Johnson-Lindenstrauss with binary coins
references.reason: This paper is foundational in the field of matrix sketching, introducing the use of binary coins for efficient dimensionality reduction.

references.paper_title: The fast Johnson–Lindenstrauss transform and approximate nearest neighbors
references.reason: This paper presents a fast algorithm for the Johnson-Lindenstrauss transform, crucial for efficient dimensionality reduction in high-dimensional data.

references.paper_title: Numerical linear algebra in the streaming model
references.reason: This paper establishes fundamental space and time lower bounds for numerical linear algebra computations in the streaming model, relevant to the paper's focus on space-efficient distributed algorithms.

references.paper_title: Sparse sketches with small inversion bias
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of Leverage Score Sparsification (LESS), a key technique used in the current work to design sparse sketching matrices with minimal bias.
This survey paper provides a comprehensive overview of Randomized Numerical Linear Algebra (RandNLA), the broader field within which the current research is situated.
